content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/contargo-types is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with, then update the code to migrate from Java 8 to Java 17.

First, I'll:
1. View the repository structure
2. Check the pom.xml file to see current Java version and dependencies
3. Update Java version to 17
4. Update dependencies to versions compatible with Java 17
5. Run `mvn clean verify` to check if everything works
6. Fix any issues that arise

Content: <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>net.contargo</groupId>
    <artifactId>contargo-types</artifactId>
    <version>0.19.0</version>
    <packaging>jar</packaging>

    <name>Contargo Types</name>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <project.reporting.outputEncoding>UTF-8</project.reporting.outputEncoding>
        <jdk.version>1.8</jdk.version>
    </properties>

    <scm>
        <connection>scm:git:ssh://git@github.com/Contargo/contargo-types.git</connection>
        <developerConnection>scm:git:ssh://git@github.com/Contargo/contargo-types.git</developerConnection>
        <tag>HEAD</tag>
    </scm>

    <repositories>
        <repository>
            <id>jitpack.io</id>
            <url>https://jitpack.io</url>
        </repository>
    </repositories>

    <dependencies>

        <!-- CONTARGO -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.github.Contargo</groupId>
            <artifactId>contargo-domain</artifactId>
            <version>v0.3.0</version>
        </dependency>

        <!-- VALIDATION -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>javax.validation</groupId>
            <artifactId>validation-api</artifactId>
            <version>2.0.1.Final</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>

        <!-- COMMON -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.googlecode.libphonenumber</groupId>
            <artifactId>libphonenumber</artifactId>
            <version>8.8.7</version>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>commons-lang</groupId>
            <artifactId>commons-lang</artifactId>
            <version>2.6</version>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
            <version>1.7.25</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- TEST DEPENDENCIES -->

        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.13.1</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.hibernate</groupId>
            <artifactId>hibernate-validator</artifactId>
            <version>5.3.6.Final</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.mockito</groupId>
            <artifactId>mockito-core</artifactId>
            <version>1.10.19</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.5.1</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>${jdk.version}</source>
                    <target>${jdk.version}</target>
                    <showDeprecation>true</showDeprecation>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-source-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.0.0</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>attach-sources</id>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>jar-no-fork</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>2.10.3</version>
                <configuration>
                    <show>package</show>
                </configuration>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>attach-javadocs</id>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>jar</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>

</project>

    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>net.contargo</groupId>

    <version>0.19.0</version>
    <packaging>jar</packaging>

    <name>Contargo Types</name>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <project.reporting.outputEncoding>UTF-8</project.reporting.outputEncoding>
        <jdk.version>17</jdk.version>

        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>

    <scm>
        <connection>scm:git:ssh://git@github.com/Contargo/contargo-types.git</connection>
        <developerConnection>scm:git:ssh://git@github.com/Contargo/contargo-types.git</developerConnection>

    <repositories>
        <repository>
            <id>jitpack.io</id>
            <url>https://jitpack.io</url>
        </repository>
    </repositories>

    <dependencies>

        <!-- CONTARGO -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.github.Contargo</groupId>
            <artifactId>contargo-domain</artifactId>
            <version>v0.3.0</version>
        </dependency>

        <!-- VALIDATION -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>jakarta.validation</groupId>
            <artifactId>jakarta.validation-api</artifactId>
            <version>3.0.2</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>

        <!-- COMMON -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.googlecode.libphonenumber</groupId>

        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.commons</groupId>

        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>

        <!-- TEST DEPENDENCIES -->

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit-jupiter</artifactId>
            <version>5.10.1</version>
            <scope>test</scope>

input.command: cd /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/contargo-types && find src -name "*.java" -type f -exec sed -i 's/import javax\.validation\./import jakarta.validation./g' {} \;

I see the pattern. But wait, let me double-check the sed result:
assertEquals("Wrong String representation for: " + value, "HLXU 123456-7", containerNumber.toString());

Good! Now in JUnit 5, assertEquals has the signature: `assertEquals(expected, actual, message)` where message is optional and at the end. But in JUnit 4 it was `assertEquals(message, expected, actual)`. Let me use a Python script to fix this:

input.command:
cd /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/contargo-types && cat > /tmp/fix_asserts.py << 'EOF'
import re
import sys

def fix_assertions(content):
    # Pattern for assertEquals, assertTrue, assertFalse, assertNotNull, assertNull with message first
    # Match: assertEquals("message", expected, actual) -> assertEquals(expected, actual, "message")
    
    # Pattern for assertEquals with 3 parameters
    pattern = r'(assertEquals|assertNotNull|assertNull)\(("[^"]+"|"[^"]*"(?:\s*\+\s*[^,]+)*),\s*([^,]+),\s*([^)]+)\)'
    def replacer(match):
        method = match.group(1)
        message = match.group(2)
        expected = match.group(3)
        actual = match.group(4)
        return f'{method}({expected}, {actual}, {message})'
    
    content = re.sub(pattern, replacer, content)
    
    # Pattern for assertTrue/assertFalse with 2 parameters (message, condition)
    pattern2 = r'(assertTrue|assertFalse)\(("[^"]+"|"[^"]*"(?:\s*\+\s*[^,]+)*),\s*([^)]+)\)'
    def replacer2(match):
        method = match.group(1)
        message = match.group(2)
        condition = match.group(3)
        return f'{method}({condition}, {message})'
    
    content = re.sub(pattern2, replacer2, content)
    
    return content

if __name__ == '__main__':
    filename = sys.argv[1]
    with open(filename, 'r') as f:
        content = f.read()
    
    fixed = fix_assertions(content)
    
    with open(filename, 'w') as f:
        f.write(fixed)
EOF
python3 /tmp/fix_asserts.py src/test/java/net/contargo/types/container/ContainerNumberTest.java
